analyzed: santaḥ pratiṣṭhāḥ hi sukha cyutānām satām sadā eva amararāja kalpa
translated: For the virtuous are the support of those fallen from happiness, always like the lord of the gods.

original: te saṃgatāḥ sthāvarajaṅgameśāḥ pratiṣṭhitastvaṃ sadṛśeṣu satsu // / //
analyzed: te saṃgatāḥ sthāvara jaṅgama īśāḥ pratiṣṭhitaḥ tvam sadṛśeṣu satsu
translated: Those lords of the moving and unmoving have assembled, and you are established among the virtuous.

analyzed: prabhuḥ agniḥ pratapane bhūmiḥ āvapane prabhuḥ
translated: Fire is powerful in heating, the earth is powerful in sowing,

original: prabhuḥ sūryaḥ prakāśācca satāṃ cābhyāgataḥ prabhuḥ // / //
analyzed: prabhuḥ sūryaḥ prakāśāt ca satām ca abhyāgataḥ prabhuḥ
translated: The sun is powerful in illuminating, and a guest is powerful among the virtuous.

analyzed: matsyapurāṇa
translated: Matsya Purana

analyzed: yayātiḥ uvāca
translated: Yayati said:

original: ahaṃ yayātirnahuṣasya putraḥ pūroḥ pitā sarvabhūtāvamānāt /
analyzed: aham yayātiḥ nahuṣasya putraḥ pūroḥ pitā sarva bhūta avamānāt
translated: I am Yayati, the son of Nahusha, the father of Puru, fallen from the worlds of gods and siddhas because of disrespecting all beings.

analyzed: prabhraṃśitaḥ ham sura siddha lokāt paricyutaḥ prapatāmi alpa puṇyaḥ
translated: Deprived of my high position, I am falling down, my merit being small.

original: ahaṃ hi pūrvo vayasā bhavadbhayas tenābhivādaṃ bhavatāṃ na yuñje /
analyzed: aham hi pūrvaḥ vayasā bhavat bhayaḥ tena abhivādam bhavatām na yuñje
translated: I am older than you in age, therefore it is not proper for me to greet you.

original: yo vidyayā tapasā janmanā vā vṛddhaḥ sa vai sambhavati dvijānām // / //
analyzed: yaḥ vidyayā tapasā janmanā vā vṛddhaḥ sa vai sambhavati dvijānām
translated: But one who is advanced in knowledge, austerities or birth is considered the elder among the twice-born.

analyzed: aṣṭakaḥ uvāca
translated: Ashtaka said:

original: avādīstvaṃ vayasāsmi pravṛddha iti vai rājann adhikaḥ kathaṃcit /
analyzed: avādīḥ tvam vayasā asmi pravṛddhaḥ iti vai rājan adhikaḥ kathaṃcid
translated: O king, you said that you are older in age, therefore you are in some way superior.

original: yo vai vidvāṃstapasā sampravṛddhaḥ sa eva pūjyo bhavati dvijānām // / //
analyzed: yaḥ vai vidvān tapasā sampravṛddhaḥ saḥ eva pūjyaḥ bhavati dvijānām
translated: But one who is advanced in knowledge and austerities is indeed worthy of respect among the twice-born.

analyzed: yayātiḥ uvāca
translated: Yayati said:

original: pratikūlaṃ karmaṇāṃ pāpamāhus tadvartināṃ pravaṇaṃ pāpalokam /
analyzed: pratikūlam karmaṇām pāpam āhuḥ tad vartinām pravaṇam pāpa lokam
translated: They say that the opposite of good deeds is sin, and those who follow it go to a sinful world.

original: santo 'sato nānvavartanta te vai yadātmanaiṣāṃ pratikūlavādī // / //
analyzed: santaḥ sataḥ na anvavartanta te vai yat ātmanā eṣām pratikūla vādī
translated: The good do not follow the bad, for they oppose their own self.

original: abhūddhanaṃ me vipulaṃ mahadvai viceṣṭamāno 'dhigantā tadasmi /
analyzed: abhūt dhanam me vipulam mahat vai viceṣṭamānaḥ dhik antā tat asmi
translated: I had great and abundant wealth, but by striving I have obtained it.

original: evaṃ pradhāryātmahite niviṣṭo yo vartate sa vijānāti dhīraḥ // / //
analyzed: evam pradhārya ātma hite niviṣṭaḥ yaḥ vartate sa vijānāti dhīraḥ
translated: Having considered this, one who is established in his own welfare and acts accordingly, he is a wise and learned man.

analyzed: nānābhāvāḥ bahavaḥ jīva loke daiva adhīnāḥ naṣṭa ceṣṭā adhikārāḥ
translated: In the world of living beings, many things are dependent on fate, with the power of action lost.

original: tattatprāpya na vihanyeta dhīro diṣṭaṃ balīya iti matvātmabuddhyā // / //
analyzed: tat tat prāpya na vihanyeta dhīraḥ diṣṭam balīyaḥ iti matvā ātma buddhyā
translated: Having attained each of these, the wise one should not be thwarted, considering fate to be powerful with his own intellect.

original: sukhaṃ hi janturyadi vāpi duḥkhaṃ daivādhīnaṃ vindati nātmaśaktyā /
analyzed: sukham hi jantuḥ yadi vā api duḥkham daiva adhīnam vindati na ātma śaktyā
translated: For a creature obtains happiness or sorrow dependent on fate, not by his own power.

analyzed: tasmāt diṣṭam balavat manyamānaḥ na saṃjvaret nā api hṛṣyet kadācid
translated: Therefore, considering fate to be powerful, one should neither be agitated nor delighted at any time.

original: duḥkhe na tapyeta sukhe na hṛṣyet samena varteta sadaiva dhīraḥ /
analyzed: duḥkhe na tapyeta sukhe na hṛṣyet samena varteta sadā eva dhīraḥ
translated: In sorrow he should not be tormented, in happiness he should not rejoice, the wise one should always remain even.

original: diṣṭaṃ balīya iti manyamāno na saṃjvarennāpi hṛṣyet kadācit // / //
analyzed: diṣṭam balīyaḥ iti manyamānaḥ na saṃjvaret na api hṛṣyet kadācid
translated: Considering fate to be powerful, he should neither be agitated nor delighted at any time.

original: bhaye na muhyāmyaṣṭakāhaṃ kadācit saṃtāpo me manaso nāsti kaścit /
analyzed: bhaye na muhyāmi aṣṭaka aham kadācid saṃtāpaḥ me manasaḥ nā asti kaścid
translated: I am never confused in fear, I have no sorrow in my mind at all.

original: dhātā yathā māṃ vidadhāti loke dhruvaṃ tathāhaṃ bhaviteti matvā // / //
analyzed: dhātā yathā mām vidadhāti loke dhruvam tathā aham bhavitā iti matvā
translated: Considering that the Creator will surely create me in the world as he wishes,

original: saṃsvedajā hy aṇḍajā hy udbhidaśca sarīsṛpāḥ kṛmayo 'py apsu matsyāḥ /
analyzed: saṃsveda jāḥ hi aṇḍa jāḥ hi udbhidaḥ ca sarīsṛpāḥ kṛmayaḥ pi apsu matsyāḥ
translated: For sweat-born, egg-born, and plant-born creatures, reptiles, worms, and fish in the water,

original: tathāśmānastṛṇakāṣṭhaṃ ca sarvaṃ diṣṭakṣaye svāṃ prakṛtiṃ bhajante // / //
analyzed: tathā aśmānaḥ tṛṇa kāṣṭham ca sarvam diṣṭa kṣaye svām prakṛtim bhajante
translated: And likewise stones, grass, and wood - all return to their own nature when fate is exhausted.

original: anityatāṃ sukhaduḥkhasya buddhvā kasmāt saṃtāpamaṣṭakāhaṃ bhajeyam /
analyzed: anitya tām sukha duḥkhasya buddhvā kasmāt saṃtāpam aṣṭaka aham bhajeyam
translated: Knowing the impermanence of happiness and sorrow, why should I grieve for eight days?

original: kiṃ kuryāṃ vai kiṃca kṛtvā na tapye tasmātsaṃtāpaṃ varjayāmyapramattaḥ // / //
analyzed: kim kuryām vai kiṃca kṛtvā na tapye tasmāt saṃtāpam varjayāmi apramattaḥ
translated: What can I do? Having done what, shall I not grieve? Therefore, heedful, I shall avoid grief.

analyzed: śaunakaḥ uvāca
translated: Shaunaka said:

original: evaṃ bruvāṇaṃ nṛpatiṃ yayātim athāṣṭakaḥ punarevānvapṛcchat /
analyzed: evam bruvāṇam nṛpatim yayātim atha aṣṭakaḥ punar eva anvapṛcchat
translated: When King Yayati spoke thus, Ashtaka again asked:

original: mātāmahaṃ sarvaguṇopapannaṃ yatra sthitaṃ svargaloke yathāvat // / //
analyzed: mātāmaham sarva guṇa upapannam yatra sthitam svarga loke yathāvat
translated: Where is my grandfather, endowed with all virtues, residing in the heavenly world as it should be?

analyzed: aṣṭakaḥ uvāca
translated: Ashtaka said:

original: ye ye lokāḥ pārthivendra pradhānās tvayā bhuktā yaṃ ca kāle yathā ca /
analyzed: ye ye lokāḥ pārthiva indra pradhānāḥ tvayā bhuktāḥ yam ca kāle yathā ca
translated: O lord of kings, tell me all about the worlds that you have enjoyed, and the time and manner in which you have enjoyed them.

original: tanme rājanbrūhi sarvaṃ yathāvat kṣetrajñavadbhāṣase tvaṃ hi dharmam // / //
analyzed: tat me rājan brūhi sarvam yathāvat kṣetrajña vat bhāṣase tvam hi dharmam
translated: O king, speak to me about it as it truly is, for you speak about dharma like one who knows the truth.

analyzed: yayātiḥ uvāca
translated: Yayati said:

original: rājāhamāsaṃ tv iha sārvabhaumas tato lokānmahataś cājaryaṃ vai /🔽tatrāvasaṃ varṣasahasramātraṃ tato lokānparamānabhyupetaḥ // / //
analyzed: rājā aham āsam tu iha sārvabhaumaḥ tatas lokān mahataḥ ca ajaryam vai  tatra avasam varṣa sahasra mātram tatas lokān paramān abhyupetaḥ
translated: Here I was a king, a universal monarch, then from the great world of immortality,🔽I lived there for a thousand years, then I attained the highest worlds.

original: tataḥ purīṃ puruhūtasya ramyāṃ sahasradvārāṃ śatayojanāntām /
analyzed: tatas purīm puruhūtasya ramyām sahasra dvārām śata yojana antām
translated: Then I went to the beautiful city of Indra, with a thousand gates, extending for a hundred yojanas,

analyzed: adhyāvasam varṣa sahasra mātram tatas lokān paramān abhyupetaḥ
translated: I lived there for a thousand years, and then attained the highest worlds.

original: tato divyamajaraṃ prāpya lokaṃ prajāpater lokapaterdurāpam /
analyzed: tatas divyam ajaram prāpya lokam prajāpateḥ loka pateḥ durāpam
translated: Then I attained the divine, ageless world of Prajapati, the lord of the worlds, which is difficult to reach.

analyzed: tatra avasam varṣa sahasra mātram tatas lokān paramān abhyupetaḥ
translated: I lived there for a thousand years, and then attained the highest worlds.

original: devasya devasya niveśane ca vijitya lokānnyavasaṃ yatheṣṭam /
analyzed: devasya devasya niveśane ca vijitya lokān nyavasam yatheṣṭam
translated: In the abode of each god, having conquered the worlds, I lived as I pleased.

analyzed: sampūjyamānaḥ tridaśaiḥ samastaiḥ tulya prabhāva dyutiḥ īśvarāṇām
translated: Honored by all the gods, with equal power and radiance as the lords,

analyzed: tathā avasam nandane kāmarūpī saṃvatsarāṇām ayutam śatānām
translated: Thus I lived in Nandana, assuming any form I desired, for a hundred thousand years.

analyzed: saha apsarobhiḥ vicaran puṇya gandhān paśyan nagān puṣpitān cāru rūpān
translated: Wandering with the apsaras, seeing the flowering trees of beautiful form,

original: tatra sthitaṃ māṃ devasukheṣu saktaṃ kāle 'tīte mahati tato 'timātram /
analyzed: tatra sthitam mām deva sukheṣu saktam kāle tīte mahati timātram
translated: While I was there, attached to the pleasures of the gods, a great deal of time passed.

analyzed: dūtaḥ devānām abravīt ugra rūpaḥ dhvaṃsa iti uccais tris plutena svareṇa
translated: Then a messenger of the gods, of fierce form, said in a loud voice with three extended notes, You must perish.

original: etāvanme viditaṃ rājasiṃha tato bhraṣṭo 'haṃ nandanātkṣīṇapuṇyaḥ /
analyzed: etāvat me viditam rāja siṃha tatas bhraṣṭaḥ ham nandanāt kṣīṇa puṇyaḥ
translated: O lion among kings, this much I know. Then, my merit exhausted, I fell from Nandana.

original: vāco 'śrauṣaṃ cāntarikṣe surāṇām anukrośācchocatāṃ māṃ narendra // / //🔽akasmādvai kṣīṇapuṇyo yayātiḥ patatyasau puṇyakṛtpuṇyakīrtiḥ /
analyzed: vācaḥ śrauṣam ca antarikṣe surāṇām anukrośāt śocatām mām narendra  akasmāt vai kṣīṇa puṇyaḥ yayātiḥ patati asau puṇya kṛt puṇya kīrtiḥ
translated: And I heard the voices of the gods in the sky, lamenting out of compassion for me, O lord of men.

original: tānabruvaṃ patamānastadāhaṃ satāṃ madhye nipateyaṃ kathaṃ nu // / //
analyzed: tān abruvam patamānaḥ tadā aham satām madhye nipateyam katham nu
translated: Yudhisthira said: Yudhisthira said, 'O son of Nahusha, how did Yayati, the son of Nahusha, fall from heaven? Tell me that, O best of the twice-born.'

original: tairākhyātāṃ bhavatāṃ yajñabhūmiṃ samīkṣya caināmahamāgato 'smi /🔽havirgandhair darśitāṃ yajñabhūmiṃ dhūmāpāṅgaṃ parigṛhya pratītām // / //
analyzed: taiḥ ākhyātām bhavatām yajña bhūmim samīkṣya ca enām aham āgataḥ smi  haviḥ gandhaiḥ darśitām yajña bhūmim dhūma apāṅgam parigṛhya pratītām
translated: The son of Nahusha said, 'O king, listen to the story of Yayati, the son of Nahusha, as I relate it to you.'🔽 The son of Nahusha said, 'O king, listen to the story of Yayati, the son of Nahusha, as I relate it to you.'🔽 The son of Nahusha said, 'O king, listen to the story of Yayati, the son of Nahusha, as I relate it to you.'🔽 The son of Nahusha said, 'O king, listen to the story of Yayati, the son of Nahusha, as I relate it to you.'

analyzed: matsyapurāṇa
translated: Matsya Purana

analyzed: aṣṭakaḥ uvāca
translated: Ashtaka said:

analyzed: yadā vasan nandane kāmarūpe saṃvatsarāṇām ayutam śatānām
translated: When you lived in Nandana, assuming any form you desired, for ten thousand and one hundred years,

original: kiṃkāraṇaṃ kārtayugapradhāna hitvā tadvai vasudhām anvapadyaḥ // / //
analyzed: kiṃkāraṇam kārtayuga pradhāna hitvā tat vai vasudhām anvapadyaḥ
translated: Why did you, the foremost of the Krita age, leave that and come to earth?

analyzed: yayātiḥ uvāca
translated: Yayati said:

original: jñātiḥ suhṛtsvajano yo yatheha kṣīṇe vitte tyajyate mānavairhi /
analyzed: jñātiḥ suhṛd sva janaḥ yaḥ yathā iha kṣīṇe vitte tyajyate mānavaiḥ hi
translated: Here, when wealth is exhausted, kinsmen, friends and relatives are abandoned by men.

original: tathā svarge kṣīṇapuṇyaṃ manuṣyaṃ tyajanti sadyaḥ khecarā devasaṃghāḥ // / //
analyzed: tathā svarge kṣīṇa puṇyam manuṣyam tyajanti sadyas khecarāḥ deva saṃghāḥ
translated: Similarly, the celestial hosts immediately abandon a man whose merit is exhausted in heaven.

analyzed: aṣṭakaḥ uvāca
translated: Ashtaka said:

original: kathaṃ tasminkṣīṇapuṇyā bhavanti saṃmuhyate me 'tra mano 'timātram /
analyzed: katham tasmin kṣīṇa puṇyāḥ bhavanti saṃmuhyate me tra mano timātram
translated: How do they become destitute of merit in that (hell)? My mind is greatly confused about this.

original: kiṃviśiṣṭāḥ kasya dhāmopayānti tadvai brūhi kṣetravittvaṃ mato me // / //
analyzed: kiṃviśiṣṭāḥ kasya dhāma upayānti tat vai brūhi kṣetravid tvam mataḥ me
translated: What are they like? To whose abode do they go? Please tell me that, for I consider you to be knowledgeable about the field (of dharma and adharma).

analyzed: yayātiḥ uvāca
translated: Yayati said:

original: imaṃ bhaumaṃ narakaṃ te patanti lālapyamānā naradeva sarve /
analyzed: imam bhaumam narakam te patanti lālapyamānāḥ naradeva sarve
translated: They fall into this earthly hell, lamenting, O king of men, all of them.

original: te kaṅkagomāyupalāśanārthaṃ kṣitau vivṛddhiṃ bahudhā prayānti // / //
analyzed: te kaṅka gomāyu palāśana artham kṣitau vivṛddhim bahudhā prayānti
translated: They attain great growth in various ways on the earth for the sake of herons, jackals, and crows.

original: tasmādevaṃ varjanīyaṃ narendra duṣṭaṃ loke garhaṇīyaṃ ca karma /
analyzed: tasmāt evam varjanīyam narendra duṣṭam loke garhaṇīyam ca karma
translated: Therefore, O king, this evil deed, which is condemned in the world, should be avoided.

original: ākhyātaṃ te pārthiva sarvametad bhūyaścedānīṃ vada kiṃ te vadāmi // / //
analyzed: ākhyātam te pārthiva sarvam etat bhūyas ca idānīm vada kim te vadāmi
translated: I have told you all this. What more do you want to hear from me now? Tell me.

analyzed: aṣṭakaḥ uvāca
translated: Ashtaka said:

original: yadā tu tāṃs te vitudante vayāṃsi tathā gṛdhrāḥ śitikaṇṭhāḥ pataṃgāḥ /
analyzed: yadā tu tān te vitudante vayāṃsi tathā gṛdhrāḥ śitikaṇṭhāḥ pataṃgāḥ
translated: When those birds, vultures, peacocks, and insects torment them,

original: kathaṃ bhavanti kathamābhavanti tvatto bhaumaṃ narakamahaṃ śṛṇomi // / //
analyzed: katham bhavanti katham ābhavanti tvattaḥ bhaumam narakam aham śṛṇomi
translated: how do they become (what they were before)? How do they come to be? I hear from you about the earthly hell.

analyzed: yayātiḥ uvāca
translated: Yayati said:

original: ūrdhvaṃ dehātkarmaṇo jṛmbhamāṇād vyaktaṃ pṛthivyām anusaṃcaranti /
analyzed: ūrdhvam dehāt karmaṇaḥ jṛmbhamāṇāt vyaktam pṛthivyām anusaṃcaranti
translated: From the expanding karma after the body, they are clearly seen moving on the earth.

original: imaṃ bhaumaṃ narakaṃ te patanti nāvekṣante varṣapūgānanekān // / //
analyzed: imam bhaumam narakam te patanti na avekṣante varṣa pūgān anekān
translated: They fall into this hell of the earth and do not see the light for many years.

original: ṣaṣṭiṃ sahasrāṇi patanti vyomni tathāśītiṃ caiva tu vatsarāṇām /
analyzed: ṣaṣṭim sahasrāṇi patanti vyomni tathā aśītim ca eva tu vatsarāṇām
translated: For sixty thousand years they fall through the sky, and for eighty thousand years as well.

original: tānvai nudante prapatantaḥ prayātān bhīmā bhaumā rākṣasās tīkṣṇadaṃṣṭrāḥ // / //
analyzed: tān vai nudante prapatantaḥ prayātān bhīmāḥ bhaumāḥ rākṣasāḥ tīkṣṇa daṃṣṭrāḥ
translated: The terrible earth-dwelling demons with sharp fangs chase them as they fall.

analyzed: aṣṭakaḥ uvāca
translated: Ashtaka said:

analyzed: yat etān te saṃpatataḥ tudanti bhīmāḥ bhaumāḥ rākṣasāḥ tīkṣṇa daṃṣṭrāḥ
translated: When the terrible earth-dwelling demons with sharp fangs torment them as they fall,

original: kathaṃ bhavanti kathamābhavanti kathaṃbhūtā garbhabhūtā bhavanti // / //
analyzed: katham bhavanti katham ābhavanti kathaṃbhūtāḥ garbha bhūtāḥ bhavanti
translated: How do they become? How do they exist? How are they when they are in the womb?

analyzed: yayātiḥ uvāca
translated: Yayati said:

original: asṛgretaḥ puṣparasānuyuktam anveti sadyaḥ puruṣeṇa sṛṣṭam /
analyzed: asṛj retaḥ puṣpa rasa anuyuktam anveti sadyas puruṣeṇa sṛṣṭam
translated: The semen mixed with blood and menstrual fluid created by a man immediately follows.

original: tava tarayā raja āpadyate ca sa garbhabhūtaḥ samupaiti tatra // / //
analyzed: tava tarayā rajaḥ āpadyate ca sa garbha bhūtaḥ samupaiti tatra
translated: When the menstrual blood arrives, it becomes the embryo and goes there.

original: vanaspatīn oṣadhīṃścāviśanti apo vāyuṃ pṛthivīṃ cāntarikṣam /
analyzed: vanaspatīn oṣadhīn ca āviśanti apaḥ vāyum pṛthivīm ca antarikṣam
translated: They enter trees, herbs, water, air, earth, space,

original: catuṣpadaṃ dvipadaṃ cāpi sarva evaṃbhūtā garbhabhūtā bhavanti // / //
analyzed: catuṣpadam dvipadam ca api sarve evaṃbhūtāḥ garbha bhūtāḥ bhavanti
translated: four-legged and two-legged beings. In this way, they become beings in the womb.

analyzed: aṣṭakaḥ uvāca
translated: Ashtaka said:

analyzed: anyat vapuḥ vidadhāti iha garbhaḥ uta āhosvit svena kāmena yāti
translated: Here, does the embryo take on a different body, or does it go with its own desire?

analyzed: āpadyamānaḥ nara yonim etām ācakṣva me saṃśayāt pṛcchataḥ tvam
translated: When you are born, you attain this human birth. Tell me this, I ask you out of doubt.

original: śarīradehādisamucchrayaṃ ca cakṣuḥśrotre labhate kena saṃjñām /
analyzed: śarīra deha ādi samucchrayam ca cakṣuḥ śrotre labhate kena saṃjñām
translated: And how does one get the names of eyes and ears for the body, form, and other things?

original: etatsarvaṃ tāta ācakṣva pṛṣṭaḥ kṣetrajñaṃ tvāṃ manyamānā hi sarve // / //
analyzed: etat sarvam tāta ācakṣva pṛṣṭaḥ kṣetrajñam tvām manyamānāḥ hi sarve
translated: Tell me all this, O father, when asked. For we all consider you to be omniscient.

analyzed: yayātiḥ uvāca
translated: Yayati said:

original: vāyuḥ samutkarṣati garbhayonim ṛtau retaḥ puṣparasānuyuktam /
analyzed: vāyuḥ samutkarṣati garbha yonim ṛtau retaḥ puṣpa rasa anuyuktam
translated: The wind carries the semen, mixed with the essence of the menstrual blood, into the womb at the right time.

original: sa tatra tanmātrakṛtādhikāraḥ krameṇa saṃvardhayatīha garbham // / //
analyzed: sa tatra tanmātra kṛta adhikāraḥ krameṇa saṃvardhayati iha garbham
translated: He, having that much authority there, gradually develops the embryo here.

original: sa jāyamāno 'tha gṛhītamātraḥ saṃjñāmadhiṣṭhāya tato manuṣyaḥ /
analyzed: sa gṛhīta mātraḥ saṃjñām adhiṣṭhāya tatas manuṣyaḥ
translated: Then, when he is born and just taken up, the human being, having taken on consciousness,

original: sa śrotrābhyāṃ vedayatīha śabdaṃ sa vai rūpaṃ paśyati cakṣuṣā ca // / //
analyzed: sa śrotrābhyām vedayati iha śabdam sa vai rūpam paśyati cakṣuṣā ca
translated: He perceives sound here by the ears, and he sees form by the eyes.

original: ghrāṇena gandhaṃ jihvayātho rasaṃ ca tvacā sparśaṃ manasā devabhāvam /
analyzed: ghrāṇena gandham jihvayā atho rasam ca tvacā sparśam manasā deva bhāvam
translated: He smells scent by the nose, and he tastes flavor by the tongue, and he feels touch by the skin, and by the mind he knows the state of being a god.

original: ityaṣṭakehopacitaṃ hi viddhi mahātmanaḥ prāṇabhṛtaḥ śarīre // / //
analyzed: iti aṣṭaka iha upacitam hi viddhi mahātmanaḥ prāṇabhṛtaḥ śarīre
translated: Know that this is accumulated in the eight-fold body of the great-souled one in the body of a living being.

analyzed: aṣṭakaḥ uvāca
translated: Ashtaka said:

original: yaḥ saṃsthitaḥ puruṣo dahyate vā nikhanyate vāpi nikṛṣyate vā /
analyzed: yaḥ saṃsthitaḥ puruṣaḥ dahyate vā nikhanyate vā api nikṛṣyate vā
translated: The man who is standing, being burned, or being dug up or dragged,

original: abhāvabhūtaḥ sa vināśametya kenātmānaṃ cetayate purastāt // / //
analyzed: abhāva bhūtaḥ sa vināśam etya kena ātmānam cetayate purastāt
translated: Having become non-existent, having met with destruction, by what does one recollect one's self in the past?

analyzed: yayātiḥ uvāca
translated: Yayati said:

original: hitvā so 'sūn suptavanniṣṭhitatvāt purodhāya sukṛtaṃ duṣkṛtaṃ ca /
analyzed: hitvā saḥ sūn supta vat niṣṭhita tvāt purodhāya sukṛtam duṣkṛtam ca
translated: Having abandoned the body, like one asleep due to being absorbed, having placed good and bad deeds ahead,

original: anyāṃ yoniṃ puṇyapāpānusārāṃ hitvā dehaṃ bhajate rājasiṃha // / //
analyzed: anyām yonim puṇya pāpa anusārām hitvā deham bhajate rāja siṃha
translated: Abandoning another birth that follows merit and demerit, he attains a body, O lion among kings.

original: puṇyāṃ yoniṃ puṇyakṛto viśanti pāpāṃ yoniṃ pāpakṛto vrajanti /
analyzed: puṇyām yonim puṇya kṛtaḥ viśanti pāpām yonim pāpa kṛtaḥ vrajanti
translated: The virtuous enter a virtuous birth, the sinful go to a sinful birth.

original: kīṭāḥ pataṃgāśca bhavanti pāpān na me vivakṣāsti mahānubhāva // / //
analyzed: kīṭāḥ pataṃgāḥ ca bhavanti pāpāt na me vivakṣā asti mahā anubhāva
translated: The sinful become insects and moths, O magnanimous one, I have no desire to speak.

original: catuṣpadā dvipadāḥ pakṣiṇaśca tathābhūtā garbhabhūtā bhavanti /
analyzed: catuṣpadāḥ dvipadāḥ pakṣiṇaḥ ca tathābhūtāḥ garbha bhūtāḥ bhavanti
translated: The four-legged, the two-legged, and the birds, in that state, become embryos.

original: ākhyātametannikhilaṃ hi sarvaṃ bhūyastu kiṃ pṛcchasi rājasiṃha // / //
analyzed: ākhyātam etat nikhilam hi sarvam bhūyas tu kim pṛcchasi rāja siṃha
translated: All this has been told in detail, O lion among kings, what more do you ask?

analyzed: aṣṭakaḥ uvāca
translated: Ashtaka said:

original: kiṃ svitkṛtvā labhate tāta saṃjñāṃ martyaḥ śreṣṭhāṃ tapasā vidyayā vā /
analyzed: kim svid kṛtvā labhate tāta saṃjñām martyaḥ śreṣṭhām tapasā vidyayā vā
translated: Having done what, O father, does a mortal attain the highest knowledge through austerities or learning?

original: tanme pṛṣṭaḥ śaṃsa sarvaṃ yathāvac chubhāṃllokān yena gacchetkrameṇa // / //
analyzed: tat me pṛṣṭaḥ śaṃsa sarvam yathāvat śubhān lokān yena gacchet krameṇa
translated: Having been asked this, tell me all as it is, by which one goes in due order to the auspicious worlds.

analyzed: yayātiḥ uvāca
translated: Yayati said:

original: tapaśca dānaṃ ca śamo damaśca hrīr ārjavaṃ sarvabhūtānukampā /
analyzed: tapaḥ ca dānam ca śamaḥ damaḥ ca hrīḥ ārjavam sarva bhūta anukampā
translated: Austerity, charity, self-control, restraint, modesty, straightforwardness, and compassion for all beings,

original: svargasya lokasya vadanti santo dvārāṇi saptaiva mahānti puṃsām // / //
analyzed: svargasya lokasya vadanti santaḥ dvārāṇi sapta eva mahānti puṃsām
translated: The wise ones say these are the seven great doors to the world of heaven for men.

analyzed: sarvāṇi ca etāni yathā uditāni tapaḥ pradhānāni abhimarṣakeṇa
translated: And all these, as mentioned, are led by austerity, by one who is ambitious.

original: naśyanti mānena tamo 'bhibhūtāḥ puṃsaḥ sadaiveti vadanti santaḥ // / //
analyzed: naśyanti mānena tamaḥ bhibhūtāḥ puṃsaḥ sadā evā iti vadanti santaḥ
translated: They perish, overwhelmed by darkness due to pride, always for a man, so say the wise.

original: adhīyānaḥ paṇḍitaṃ manyamāno yo vidyayā hanti yaśaḥ parasya /
analyzed: adhīyānaḥ paṇḍitam manyamānaḥ yaḥ vidyayā hanti yaśaḥ parasya
translated: One who studies, considering himself learned, who destroys the fame of others through his knowledge,

original: tasyāntavantaḥ puruṣasya lokā na cāsya tadbrahmaphalaṃ dadāti // / //
analyzed: tasya antavantaḥ puruṣasya lokāḥ na ca asya tat brahma phalam dadāti
translated: His worlds are limited, and that knowledge does not give him the fruit of Brahman.

analyzed: catvāri karmāṇi bhayaṃkarāṇi bhayam prayacchanti ayathākṛtāni
translated: Four actions are fearful, they give fear if done improperly:

analyzed: māna agnihotram uta māna maunam mānena adhītam uta māna yajñaḥ
translated: The fire sacrifice of pride, the silence of pride, the study of pride, and the sacrifice of pride.

original: na mānyamāno mudamādadīta na saṃtāpaṃ prāpnuyāccāvamānāt /
analyzed: na mānyamānaḥ mudam ādadīta na saṃtāpam prāpnuyāt ca avamānāt
translated: One should not take joy in being honored, nor sorrow in being disrespected.

original: santaḥ sataḥ pūjayantīha loke nāsādhavaḥ sādhubuddhiṃ labhante // / //
analyzed: santaḥ sataḥ pūjayanti iha loke na asādhavaḥ sādhu buddhim labhante
translated: The good ones here in the world honor the good, the wicked do not attain the understanding of the good.

original: iti dadyāditi yajed ityadhīyīta me śrutam /
analyzed: iti dadyāt iti yajet iti adhīyīta me śrutam
translated: Thus have I heard: One should give, one should sacrifice, one should study.

analyzed: iti etāni abhayāni āhuḥ tāni avarjyāni nityaśas
translated: These are said to be the fears, which should always be avoided.

original: yenāśrayaṃ vedayante purāṇaṃ manīṣiṇo mānase mānayuktam /
analyzed: yena āśrayam vedayante purāṇam manīṣiṇaḥ mānase māna yuktam
translated: By which the wise experience the ancient abode, endowed with the mind in the mind,

original: tanniḥśreyas tena saṃyogametya parāṃ śāntiṃ prāpnuyuḥ pretya ceha // / //
analyzed: tat niḥśreyaḥ tena saṃyogam etya parām śāntim prāpnuyuḥ pretya ca iha
translated: Having attained union with that, they may attain the highest peace in the next world and in this world.

analyzed: matsyapurāṇa
translated: Matsya Purana

analyzed: aṣṭakaḥ uvāca
translated: Ashtaka said:

original: carangṛhasthaḥ kathameti devān kathaṃ bhikṣuḥ katham ācāryakarmā /
analyzed: caran gṛhasthaḥ katham eti devān katham bhikṣuḥ katham ācārya karmā
translated: How does a householder, moving about, attain the gods? How a mendicant? How one who performs the duties of a teacher?

original: vānaprasthaḥ satpathe saṃniviṣṭo bahūnyasmin samprati vedayanti // / //
analyzed: vānaprasthaḥ sat pathe saṃniviṣṭaḥ bahūni asmin samprati vedayanti
translated: How a forest hermit, established on the right path? Many say this in the present.

analyzed: yayātiḥ uvāca
translated: Yayati said:

original: āhūtādhyāyī gurukarmasu codyataḥ pūrvotthāyī caramaṃ copaśāyī /
analyzed: āhūtādhyāyī guru karmasu ca udyataḥ pūrva utthāyī caramam ca upaśāyī
translated: One who studies when called, who is diligent in the duties of the teacher, who rises before and sleeps after,

analyzed: mṛduḥ dāntaḥ dhṛtimān apramattaḥ svādhyāya śīlaḥ sidhyati brahmacārī
translated: Who is gentle, self-controlled, patient, and heedful, who is devoted to self-study, a celibate becomes successful.

analyzed: dharma āgatam prāpya dhanam yajeta dadyāt sadā eva atithīn bhojayet ca
translated: Having obtained wealth through righteous means, one should perform sacrifices, always give, and feed guests.

analyzed: an ādadānaḥ ca paraiḥ a dattam sā eṣā gṛhastha upaniṣad purāṇī
translated: And not taking what is not given by others - this is the ancient Upanishad for a householder.

original: svavīryajīvī vṛjinānnivṛtto dātā parebhyo na paropatāpī /
analyzed: sva vīrya jīvī vṛjināt nivṛttaḥ dātā parebhyaḥ na para upatāpī
translated: One who lives by one's own strength, who turns away from crookedness, who gives to others, who does not oppress others -

original: tādṛṅmuniḥ siddhimupaiti mukhyāṃ vasann araṇye niyatāhāraceṣṭaḥ // / //
analyzed: tādṛś muniḥ siddhim upaiti mukhyām vasan araṇye niyata āhāra ceṣṭaḥ
translated: Such a sage attains the foremost perfection, dwelling in the forest, with restrained food and activities.

original: aśilpajīvī vigṛhaśca nityaṃ jitendriyaḥ sarvato vipramuktaḥ /
analyzed: a śilpa jīvī vigṛhaḥ ca nityam jita indriyaḥ sarvatas vipramuktaḥ
translated: Not living by crafts, always celibate, with senses controlled, completely detached,

original: anokaśāyī laghu lipsamānaś caran deśānekacaraḥ sa bhikṣuḥ // / //
analyzed: an oka śāyī laghu lipsamānaḥ caran deśān ekacaraḥ sa bhikṣuḥ
translated: Sleeping in the open, seeking little, wandering from place to place, that mendicant...

original: rātryā yayā cābhiratāśca lokā bhavanti kāmābhijitāḥ sukhena ca /
analyzed: rātryā yayā ca abhiratāḥ ca lokāḥ bhavanti kāma abhijitāḥ sukhena ca
translated: By that night on which people are engaged in their occupations and are happily enjoying their desires,

original: tāmeva rātriṃ prayateta vidvān araṇyasaṃstho bhavituṃ yatātmā // / //
analyzed: tām eva rātrim prayateta vidvān araṇya saṃsthaḥ bhavitum yata ātmā
translated: The wise one, with self-control, should strive to be in the forest on that very night...

analyzed: daśa eva pūrvān daśa ca aparān tu jñātīn tathā ātmānam atha ekaviṃśam
translated: The dweller in the forest bestows good deeds on ten ancestors and ten descendants, as well as on himself, making twenty-one.

original: araṇyavāsī sukṛtaṃ dadhāti muktvā tv araṇye svaśarīradhātūn // / //
analyzed: araṇya vāsī sukṛtam dadhāti muktvā tu araṇye sva śarīra dhātūn
translated: But abandoning his own bodily elements in the forest, he becomes free...

analyzed: aṣṭakaḥ uvāca
translated: Ashtaka said:

analyzed: kati svid deva munayaḥ maunāni kati ca api uta
translated: How many are the divine sages and how many are the silent ones?

analyzed: bhavanti iti tat ācakṣva śrotum icchāmahe vayam
translated: Please tell us this, we wish to hear it...

analyzed: yayātiḥ uvāca
translated: Yayati said:

original: araṇye vasato yasya grāmo bhavati pṛṣṭhataḥ /
analyzed: araṇye vasataḥ yasya grāmaḥ bhavati pṛṣṭhatas
translated: He whose village is behind him while dwelling in the forest,

original: grāme vā vasato 'raṇyaṃ sa muniḥ syājjanādhipa // / //
analyzed: grāme vā vasataḥ raṇyam sa muniḥ syāt janādhipa
translated: Or whose forest is behind him while dwelling in the village, that one, O lord of men, is a sage...

analyzed: aṣṭakaḥ uvāca
translated: Ashtaka said:

analyzed: katham svid vasataḥ raṇye grāmaḥ bhavati pṛṣṭhatas
translated: How can one living in the forest have the village behind him?

original: grāme vā vasato 'raṇyaṃ kathaṃ bhavati pṛṣṭhataḥ // / //
analyzed: grāme vā vasataḥ raṇyam katham bhavati pṛṣṭhatas
translated: Or how can one living in the village have the forest behind him?

analyzed: yayātiḥ uvāca
translated: Yayati said:

analyzed: na grāmyam upayuñjīta yaḥ āraṇyaḥ muniḥ bhavet
translated: One who is a forest-dwelling sage should not use anything from the village.

analyzed: tathā asya vasataḥ raṇye grāmaḥ bhavati pṛṣṭhatas
translated: Thus, for him living in the forest, the village becomes behind him.

analyzed: an agniḥ aniketaḥ ca api a gotra caraṇaḥ muniḥ
translated: One who is without fire, without a fixed abode, without lineage or conduct, a sage,

analyzed: kaupīna ācchādanam yāvat tāvat icchet ca cīvaram
translated: should desire robes just enough to cover his private parts.

analyzed: yāvat prāṇa abhisaṃdhānam tāvat icchet ca bhojanam
translated: He should desire food just enough to sustain his life.

analyzed: tadā asya vasataḥ grāme raṇyam bhavati pṛṣṭhatas
translated: Then, for him living in the village, the forest becomes behind him.

analyzed: yaḥ tu kāmān parityajya tyakta karmā jita indriyaḥ
translated: But one who, renouncing desires, renouncing actions, with senses conquered,

original: ātiṣṭheta munir maunaṃ sa loke siddhimāpnuyāt // / //🔽dhautadantaṃ kṛttanakhaṃ sadā snātamalaṃkṛtam /
analyzed: ātiṣṭheta muniḥ maunam sa loke siddhim āpnuyāt  dhauta dantam kṛtta nakham sadā snātam alaṃkṛtam
translated: maintains the sage's silence, he attains perfection in this world.🔽Who is not worthy of worshiping him who has washed his teeth, cut his nails, always bathed and is adorned,

analyzed: asitam sita karma stham kaḥ tam nā arcitum arhati
translated: is dark, and is engaged in pure deeds?

analyzed: tapasā karśitaḥ kṣāmaḥ kṣīṇa māṃsa asthi śoṇitaḥ
translated: When one becomes emaciated by austerities, weak, with depleted flesh, bones and blood,

analyzed: yadā bhavati nirdvaṃdvaḥ muniḥ maunam samāsthitaḥ
translated: free from the pairs of opposites, a sage who has taken up silence,

original: atha lokamimaṃ jitvā lokaṃ cāpi jayetparam /
analyzed: atha lokam imam jitvā lokam ca api jayet param
translated: Having conquered this world, he should then conquer the other world.

analyzed: āsyena tu yadā āhāram go vat mṛgayate muniḥ
translated: The sage seeks food with his mouth, like a cow.

original: athāsya lokaiḥ sarvo yaḥ so 'mṛtatvāya kalpate // / //
analyzed: atha asya lokaiḥ sarvaḥ yaḥ saḥ mṛta tvāya kalpate
translated: Then all the worlds belong to him, and he is fit for immortality.

analyzed: matsyapurāṇa
translated: Matsya Purana

analyzed: aṣṭakaḥ uvāca
translated: Ashtaka said:

analyzed: kataraḥ tu etayoḥ pūrvam devānām eti sātmyatām
translated: Which of these two first attains affinity with the gods?

analyzed: ubhayoḥ dhāvataḥ rājan sūrya candramasoḥ iva
translated: Both of them run, O king, like the sun and the moon.

analyzed: yayātiḥ uvāca
translated: Yayati said:

analyzed: aniketa gṛhastheṣu kāma vṛtteṣu saṃyataḥ
translated: Among those who are homeless householders, who are restrained in conduct,

original: grāma eva caranbhikṣus tayoḥ pūrvataraṃ gataḥ // / //
analyzed: grāme eva caran bhikṣuḥ tayoḥ pūrvataram gataḥ
translated: The mendicant who wanders in the village goes before them.

original: aprāpyaṃ dīrghamāyuśca yaḥ prāpto vikṛtiṃ caret /
analyzed: a prāpyam dīrgham āyuḥ ca yaḥ prāptaḥ vikṛtim caret
translated: If one who has attained a long life span that is difficult to attain, should engage in misconduct,

analyzed: tapyeta yadi tat kṛtvā caret sogram tapaḥ tatas
translated: If one repents after doing it, one should then practice severe austerities.

original: yadvai nṛśaṃsaṃ tadapat hyamāhur yaḥ sevate dharmamanarthabuddhiḥ /
analyzed: yat vai nṛśaṃsam tat apat hi amāhuḥ yaḥ sevate dharmam anarthabuddhiḥ
translated: They say that what is cruel is a misfortune, one who serves righteousness with a mind of misfortune.

original: asāvanīśaḥ sa tathaiva rājaṃs tadārjavaṃ sa samādhistadāryam // / //
analyzed: asau anīśaḥ sa tathā eva rājan tat ārjavam sa samādhiḥ tad āryam
translated: O king, he is not the master, and it is just so, that uprightness is that concentration, that is noble.

analyzed: aṣṭakaḥ uvāca
translated: Ashtaka said:

original: kenādya tvaṃ tu prahito 'si rājan yuvā sragvī darśanīyaḥ suvarcāḥ /
analyzed: kena adya tvam tu prahitaḥ si rājan yuvā sragvī darśanīyaḥ su varcāḥ
translated: By whom are you sent today, O king, young, garlanded, handsome, of good speech?

original: kuta āgataḥ katamasyāṃ diśi tvamutāhosvitpārthivasthānam asti // / //
analyzed: kutas āgataḥ katamasyām diśi tvam uta āhosvit pārthiva sthānam asti
translated: Whence have you come? In which direction is your abode, or is it on the earth?

analyzed: yayātiḥ uvāca
translated: Yayati said:

original: imaṃ bhaumaṃ narakaṃ kṣīṇapuṇyaḥ praveṣṭum ūrvīṃ gaganādviprakīrṇaḥ /
analyzed: imam bhaumam narakam kṣīṇa puṇyaḥ praveṣṭum ūrvīm gaganāt viprakīrṇaḥ
translated: I, whose merits are exhausted, am about to enter this earthly hell, scattered from the sky to the earth.

original: uktvāhaṃ vaḥ prapatiṣyāmy anantaraṃ tvarantvamī brahmaṇo lokapā ye // / //
analyzed: uktvā aham vaḥ prapatiṣyāmi anantaram tvarantu amī brahmaṇaḥ lokapāḥ ye
translated: Having said this, I will fall down immediately. Let those guardians of Brahma's world hurry who are here.

original: satāṃ sakāśe tu vṛtaḥ prapātas te saṅgatā guṇavantastu sarve /
analyzed: satām sakāśe tu vṛtaḥ prapātaḥ te saṅgatāḥ guṇavantaḥ tu sarve
translated: The fall has been chosen in the presence of the virtuous. But all of you are endowed with virtues.

original: śakrācca labdho hi varo mayaiṣa patiṣyatā bhūmitalaṃ narendra // / //
analyzed: śakrāt ca labdhaḥ hi varaḥ mayā eṣa patiṣyatā bhūmi talam narendra
translated: And this boon has been obtained by me from Shakra, O king, as I am about to fall to the ground.

analyzed: aṣṭakaḥ uvāca
translated: Ashtaka said:

original: pṛcchāmi tvāṃ prapatantaṃ prapātaṃ yadi lokāḥ pārthiva santi me 'tra /
analyzed: pṛcchāmi tvām prapatantam prapātam yadi lokāḥ pārthiva santi me
translated: I ask you, as you are falling, if there are worlds for me here,

original: yadyantarikṣe yadi vā divi śritāḥ kṣetrajñaṃ tvāṃ tasya dharmasya manye // / //
analyzed: yadi antarikṣe yadi vā divi śritāḥ kṣetrajñam tvām tasya dharmasya manye
translated: Whether they are in the sky or in heaven. I consider you to be omniscient in that matter.

analyzed: yayātiḥ uvāca
translated: Yayati said:

original: yāvatpṛthivyāṃ vihitaṃ gavāśvaṃ sahāraṇyaiḥ paśubhiḥ pakṣibhiśca /
analyzed: yāvat pṛthivyām vihitam gavāśvam saha āraṇyaiḥ paśubhiḥ pakṣibhiḥ ca
translated: As much as the earth is covered with cows and horses, along with wild animals and birds,

original: tāvallokā divi te saṃsthitā vai tathā vijānīhi narendrasiṃha // / //
analyzed: tāvat lokāḥ divi te saṃsthitāḥ vai tathā vijānīhi narendra siṃha
translated: To that extent are the worlds established in heaven. Know it thus, O lion among kings.

analyzed: aṣṭakaḥ uvāca
translated: Ashtaka said:

original: tāṃste dadāmi mā prapata prapātaṃ ye me lokā divi rājendra santi /
analyzed: tān te dadāmi mā prapata prapātam ye me lokāḥ divi rāja indra santi
translated: I give them to you. Do not fall into the abyss, O lord of kings, the worlds that are mine in heaven.

original: yadyantarikṣe yadi vā divi śritāstānākrama kṣipramamitrahā'thasi // / //
analyzed: yadi antarikṣe yadi vā divi śritāḥ tān ākrama kṣipram amitra hāthasi
translated: If they are in the atmosphere or in heaven, O slayer of enemies, quickly ascend them and attain them.

analyzed: yayātiḥ uvāca
translated: Yayati said:

analyzed: na asmadvidhaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ brahma vid ca pratigrahe vartate rājamukhya
translated: A non-Brahmin like me, who knows Brahman, does not engage in accepting gifts, O chief among kings.

original: yathā pradeyaṃ satataṃ dvijebhyas tadā dade pūrvam ahaṃ narendra // / //
analyzed: yathā pradeyam satatam dvijebhyaḥ tadā dade pūrvam aham narendra
translated: As it is always to be given to the twice-born, I used to give it earlier, O lord of men.

original: nābrāhmaṇaḥ kṛpaṇo jātu jīved yadyapi syādbrāhmaṇī vīrapatnī /
analyzed: na abrāhmaṇaḥ kṛpaṇaḥ jātu jīvet yadi api syāt brāhmaṇī vīra patnī
translated: A non-Brahmin should never live in poverty, even if he is the husband of a Brahmin woman.

original: so 'haṃ yadevākṛtapūrvaṃ careyaṃ vivitsamānaḥ kimu tatra sādhuḥ // / //
analyzed: saḥ ham yat eva a kṛta pūrvam careyam vivitsamānaḥ kimu tatra sādhuḥ
translated: If I, desiring to obtain it, were to do what I have never done before, what is virtuous in that?

analyzed: pratardanaḥ uvāca
translated: Pratardana said:

original: pṛcchāmi tvāṃ spṛhaṇīyarūpa pratardano 'haṃ yadi me santi lokāḥ /
analyzed: pṛcchāmi tvām spṛhaṇīya rūpa pratardanaḥ ham yadi me santi lokāḥ
translated: I ask you, O one of desirable form, if I have worlds, I am Pratardana.

original: yadyantarikṣe yadi vā divi śrutāḥ kṣetrajñaṃ tvāṃ tasya dharmasya manye // / //
analyzed: yadi antarikṣe yadi vā divi śrutāḥ kṣetrajñam tvām tasya dharmasya manye
translated: If they are heard of in the atmosphere or in heaven, I consider you to be omniscient in that matter.

analyzed: yayātiḥ uvāca
translated: Yayati said:

original: santi lokā bahavaste narendra apyekaikaṃ sapta śatānyahāni /
analyzed: santi lokāḥ bahavaḥ te narendra api ekaikam sapta śatāni ahāni
translated: O lord of men, you have many worlds, even for each one, for seven hundred years.

analyzed: madhu cyutaḥ ghṛtavantaḥ viśokāḥ tena antavantaḥ pratipālayanti
translated: They are the sustainers of the world, flowing with honey, full of ghee, and free from sorrow.

analyzed: pratardanaḥ uvāca
translated: Pratardana said:

original: tāṃste dadāmi patamānasya rājan ye me lokāstava te vai bhavantu /
analyzed: tān te dadāmi patamānasya rājan ye me lokāḥ tava te vai bhavantu
translated: O king, I give you those worlds which are mine, where you are falling.

original: yadyantarikṣe yadi vā divi śritās tānākrama kṣipramapetamohaḥ // / //
analyzed: yadi antarikṣe yadi vā divi śritāḥ tān ākrama kṣipram apeta mohaḥ
translated: If they are in the sky or in heaven, quickly ascend them, free from delusion.

original: yayātiruvāca🔽nu tulyatejāḥ sukṛtaṃ hi kāmaye yogakṣemaṃ pārthivātpārthivaḥ san /
analyzed: yayātiḥ uvāca  nu tulya tejāḥ sukṛtam hi kāmaye yogakṣemam pārthivāt pārthivaḥ san
translated: Yayati said:🔽O king, being a king, I desire the same splendor and good deeds as you, the security of the kingdom.

original: daivādeśādāpadaṃ prāpya vidvāṃś carennṛśaṃsaṃ hi na jātu rājā // / //
analyzed: daiva ādeśāt āpadam prāpya vidvān caret nṛśaṃsam hi na jātu rājā
translated: A wise king should never act cruelly, even when facing a calamity due to fate's decree.

original: dharmyaṃ mārgaṃ cintayāno yaśasyaṃ kuryāttapo dharmamavekṣamāṇaḥ /
analyzed: dharmyam mārgam cintayānaḥ yaśasyam kuryāt tapaḥ dharmam avekṣamāṇaḥ
translated: Considering the righteous and glorious path, one should practice austerity and observe dharma.

original: na madvidho dharmabuddhirhi rājā hy evaṃ kuryātkṛpaṇaṃ māṃ yathāttha // / //
analyzed: na madvidhaḥ dharma buddhiḥ hi rājā hi evam kuryāt kṛpaṇam mām yathā āttha
translated: A king with a sense of dharma like me would not act as pitiably as you have said.

original: kuryāmapūrvaṃ na kṛtaṃ yadanyair vivitsamānaḥ kim u tatra sādhuḥ /
analyzed: kuryām apūrvam na kṛtam yat anyaiḥ vivitsamānaḥ kim tatra sādhuḥ
translated: What is the good of a wise man who does what has never been done by others?

original: bruvāṇamevaṃ nṛpatiṃ yayātiṃ nṛpottamo vasumānabravīt tam // / //
analyzed: bruvāṇam evam nṛpatim yayātim nṛpa uttamaḥ vasumān abravīt tam
translated: When King Yayati spoke thus, the best of kings, Vasuman, said to him:

analyzed: matsyapurāṇa
translated: Matsya Purana

analyzed: vasumān uvāca
translated: Vasuman said:

original: pṛcchāmyahaṃ vasumānauṣadaśvir yadyasti loko divi mahyaṃ narendra /
analyzed: pṛcchāmi aham vasumān auṣadaśviḥ yadī asti lokaḥ divi mahyam narendra
translated: I ask you, O Vasuman, O Ashvins, if there is a world in heaven for me, O king of men.

original: yadyantarikṣe prathito mahātman kṣetrajñaṃ tvāṃ tasya dharmasya manye // / //
analyzed: yadi antarikṣe prathitaḥ mahātman kṣetrajñam tvām tasya dharmasya manye
translated: If you are famous in the atmosphere, O great soul, I consider you to be the knower of that dharma.

analyzed: yayātiḥ uvāca
translated: Yayati said:

original: yadantarikṣaṃ pṛthivī diśaśca yattejasā tapate bhānumāṃśca /
analyzed: yat antarikṣam pṛthivī diśaḥ ca yat tejasā tapate bhānumān ca
translated: The extent of the atmosphere, earth and directions, and that which shines with splendor,

original: lokās tāvanto divi saṃsthitā vai te tvāṃ bhavantaṃ pratipālayanti // / //
analyzed: lokāḥ tāvantaḥ divi saṃsthitāḥ vai te tvām bhavantam pratipālayanti
translated: Those worlds are established in heaven, they are waiting for you, O Bhava.

analyzed: vasumān uvāca
translated: Vasuman said:

original: tāṃs te dadāmi pata māṃ prapātaṃ ye me lokāstava te vai bhavantu /
analyzed: tān te dadāmi pata mām prapātam ye me lokāḥ tava te vai bhavantu
translated: I give them to you, fall on me, let those worlds of mine be yours.

original: krīṇīṣvaināṃs tṛṇakenāpi rājan pratigrahaste yadi samyakpraduṣṭaḥ // / //
analyzed: krīṇīṣva enān tṛṇakena api rājan pratigrahaḥ te yadi samyak praduṣṭaḥ
translated: Buy them from me even with a straw, O king, if your acceptance is truly defiled.

original: yayātiruvāca🔽na mithyāhaṃ vikrayaṃ vai smarāmi mayā kṛtaṃ śiśubhāve 'pi rājan /
analyzed: yayātiḥ uvāca  na mithyā aham vikrayam vai smarāmi mayā kṛtam śiśu bhāve rājan
translated: Yayati said:🔽I do not remember having sold falsely, even in childhood, O king.

original: kuryāṃ na caivākṛtapūrvamanyair vivitsamāno vasumanna sādhu // / //
analyzed: kuryām na ca eva a kṛta pūrvam anyaiḥ vivitsamānaḥ vasumat na sādhu
translated: I would not do what has not been done by others, O Vasuman, desiring to conquer, that is not right.

analyzed: vasumān uvāca
translated: Vasuman said:

original: tāṃs tvaṃ lokānpratipadyasva rājan mayā dattānyadi neṣṭaḥ krayaste /
analyzed: tān tvam lokān pratipadyasva rājan mayā dattān yadi na iṣṭaḥ krayaḥ te
translated: Accept those worlds, O king, given by me, if you do not like to buy them.

original: nāhaṃ tānvai pratigantā narendra sarve lokāstāvakā vai bhavantu // / //
analyzed: na aham tān vai pratigantā narendra sarve lokāḥ tāvakāḥ vai bhavantu
translated: I will not go to them, O king of men. Let all the worlds be yours.

analyzed: śibiḥ uvāca
translated: Shibi said:

original: pṛcchāmi tvāṃ śibirauśīnaro 'haṃ mamāpi lokā yadi santi tāta /
analyzed: pṛcchāmi tvām śibiḥ auśīnaraḥ ham mama api lokāḥ yadi santi tāta
translated: I ask you, I am Shibi Auhsina. O father, if I have any worlds,

original: yadyantarikṣe yadi vā divi śritāḥ kṣetrajñaṃ tvāṃ tasya dharmasya manye // / //
analyzed: yadi antarikṣe yadi vā divi śritāḥ kṣetrajñam tvām tasya dharmasya manye
translated: If they are in the sky or in heaven, I consider you to be the knower of that dharma.

analyzed: yayātiḥ uvāca
translated: Yayati said:

original: na tvaṃ vācā hṛdayenāpi rājan parīpsamāno māvamaṃsthā narendra /
analyzed: na tvam vācā hṛdayena api rājan parīpsamānaḥ mā avamaṃsthāḥ narendra
translated: O king, you should not despise me even with your words or in your heart, O king of men, while seeking me.

original: tenānantā divi lokāḥ sthitā vai vidyudrūpāḥ svanavanto mahāntaḥ // / //
analyzed: tena anantāḥ divi lokāḥ sthitāḥ vai vidyut rūpāḥ svanavantaḥ mahāntaḥ
translated: Therefore, the endless worlds in heaven are established, having the form of lightning, resounding and great.

analyzed: śibiḥ uvāca
translated: Shibi said:

original: tāṃs tvaṃ lokānpratipadyasva rājan mayā dattānyadi neṣṭaḥ krayaste /
analyzed: tān tvam lokān pratipadyasva rājan mayā dattān yadi na iṣṭaḥ krayaḥ te
translated: Accept those worlds, O king, given by me, if you do not desire to buy them.

original: na cāhaṃ tānpratipadya dattvā yatra tvaṃ tāta gantāsi lokān // / //
analyzed: na ca aham tān pratipadya dattvā yatra tvam tāta gantāsi lokān
translated: And I will not accept them after giving them, where you are going, O father.

analyzed: yayātiḥ uvāca
translated: Yayati said:

analyzed: yathā tvam indra pratima prabhāvaḥ te ca api anantāḥ naradeva lokāḥ
translated: As you are like Indra in power, and those worlds are also endless, O king of men,

original: tathādya loke na rame 'nyadatte tasmācchibe nābhinandāmi vācam // / //
analyzed: tathā adya loke na rame nyadatte tasmāt śibe nā abhinandāmi vācam
translated: So I do not delight in the world given by another today. Therefore, I do not welcome Shibi's words.

analyzed: aṣṭakaḥ uvāca
translated: Ashtaka said:

analyzed: na ced ekaikaśas rājan lokān naḥ pratinandasi
translated: If you do not, O king, accept these worlds one by one,

original: sarve pradāya tāṃllokān gantāro narakaṃ vayam // / //
analyzed: sarve pradāya tān lokān gantāraḥ narakam vayam
translated: then, having given you all these worlds, we shall go to hell.

analyzed: yayātiḥ uvāca
translated: Yayati said:

analyzed: yad arhāḥ tat vadadhvam vaḥ santaḥ satya ādi darśinaḥ
translated: You virtuous ones, who see truth, ask for what you deserve.

original: ahaṃ tu nābhigṛhṇāmi yatkṛtaṃ na mayā purā // / //
analyzed: aham tu na abhigṛhṇāmi yat kṛtam na mayā purā
translated: But I do not accept what was not done by me before.

original: alipsamānasya tu me yaduktaṃ na tattathāstīha narendrasiṃha /
analyzed: alipsamānasya tu me yat uktam na tat tathā asti iha narendra siṃha
translated: O lion among kings, what I said to you who did not desire it, that is not so here.

original: asya pradānasya yadeva yuktaṃ tasyaiva cānantaphalaṃ bhaviṣyam // / //
analyzed: asya pradānasya yat eva yuktam tasya eva ca ananta phalam bhaviṣyam
translated: Whatever is proper for this gift, that alone will have endless fruit.

analyzed: aṣṭakaḥ uvāca
translated: Ashtaka said:

analyzed: kasya ete pratidṛśyante rathāḥ pañca hiraṇmayāḥ
translated: Whose are these five golden chariots seen here?

analyzed: uccais santaḥ prakāśante jvalantaḥ gni śikhāḥ iva
translated: Shining high, they appear like the flames of a burning fire.

analyzed: yayātiḥ uvāca
translated: Yayati said:

original: bhavatāṃ mama caivaite rathā bhānti hiraṇmayāḥ /
analyzed: bhavatām mama ca eva ete rathāḥ bhānti hiraṇmayāḥ
translated: These golden chariots shine for you and me.

analyzed: āruhya eteṣu gantavyam bhavadbhiḥ ca mayā saha
translated: You and I should ascend them and go together.

analyzed: aṣṭakaḥ uvāca
translated: Ashtaka said:

analyzed: ātiṣṭhasva ratham rājan vikramasva vihāyasā
translated: O king, mount the chariot and show your prowess in the sky.

analyzed: vayam api anuyāsyāmaḥ yadā kālaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: We too will follow when the time comes.

analyzed: yayātiḥ uvāca
translated: Yayati said:

original: sarvairidānīṃ gantavyaṃ saha svargo jito yataḥ /
analyzed: sarvaiḥ idānīm gantavyam saha svargaḥ jitaḥ yatas
translated: All of you should now go there, for heaven has been conquered by all of you together.

original: eṣa vo virajāḥ panthā dṛśyate devasadmagaḥ // / //
analyzed: eṣa vaḥ virajāḥ panthāḥ dṛśyate deva sadma gaḥ
translated: This path free from dust is seen leading to the abode of the gods.

analyzed: śaunakaḥ uvāca
translated: Shaunaka said:

analyzed: te bhiruhya rathān sarve prayātāḥ nṛpate nṛpāḥ
translated: O king, all those kings ascended their chariots and departed.

analyzed: ākrāmantaḥ divam bhānti dharmeṇa āvṛtya rodasī
translated: Ascending to heaven, they shine, covering the earth and sky with their virtue.

analyzed: aṣṭakaḥ uvāca
translated: Ashtaka said:

original: ahaṃ manye pūrvameko 'bhigantā sakhā cendraḥ sarvathā me mahātmā /
analyzed: aham manye pūrvam ekaḥ bhigantā sakhā ca indraḥ sarvathā me mahātmā
translated: I think I was the first to go there. Indra is my friend in every way and is very noble.

original: kasmādevaṃ śibirauśīnaro 'yam eko 'tyayāt sarvaṃ vegena vāhān // / //
analyzed: kasmāt evam śibiḥ auśīnaraḥ yam tyayāt sarvam vegena vāhān
translated: Why then did this Shibi of Ushinara alone surpass all of us and go there with his horses at full speed?

analyzed: yayātiḥ uvāca
translated: Yayati said:

analyzed: adadāt deva yānāya yāvat vittam aninditaḥ
translated: This uncensured one gave away all his wealth for the sake of Devayana.

original: uśīnarasya putro 'yaṃ tasmācchreṣṭho hi vaḥ śibiḥ // / //
analyzed: uśīnarasya putraḥ yam tasmāt śreṣṭhaḥ hi vaḥ śibiḥ
translated: Therefore, this son of Ushinara, Shibi, is the best among you all.

original: dānaṃ śaucaṃ satyamatho hy ahiṃsā hrīḥ śrīstitikṣā samatānṛśaṃsyam /
analyzed: dānam śaucam satyam atho hi ahiṃsā hrīḥ śrīḥ titikṣā sama tā ānṛśaṃsyam
translated: Charity, purity, truthfulness, non-violence, modesty, prosperity, forbearance, impartiality and harmlessness -

original: rājantyetānyatha sarvāṇi rājñi śibau sthitānyapratime subuddhyā /
analyzed: rājanti etāni atha sarvāṇi rājñi śibau sthitāni apratime su buddhyā
translated: O queen! All these virtues shine in Shibi alone, the matchless one, due to his excellent wisdom.

original: evaṃ vṛttaṃ hrīniṣevī bibharti tasmācchibir abhigantā rathena // / //
analyzed: evam vṛttam hrī niṣevī bibharti tasmāt śibiḥ abhigantā rathena
translated: Thus, he who bears this conduct and is devoted to modesty, Shibi, should be approached by the chariot.

analyzed: śaunakaḥ uvāca
translated: Shaunaka said:

analyzed: atha aṣṭakaḥ punar eva anvapṛcchat mātāmaham kautukāt indra kalpam
translated: Then Ashtaka again asked his maternal grandfather, who was like Indra, out of curiosity:

original: pṛcchāmi tvāṃ nṛpate brūhi satyaṃ kutaśca kaścāsi kathaṃ tvamāgāḥ /
analyzed: pṛcchāmi tvām nṛpate brūhi satyam kutas ca kaḥ ca asi katham tvam āgāḥ
translated: I ask you, O king, tell me the truth - where are you from, who are you, and how did you come here?

original: kṛtaṃ tvayā yaddhi na tasya kartā loke tvadanyo brāhmaṇaḥ kṣatriyo vā // / //
analyzed: kṛtam tvayā yat hi na tasya kartā loke tvad anyaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ kṣatriyaḥ vā
translated: There is no other brahmin or kshatriya in the world who can do what you have done.

analyzed: yayātiḥ uvāca
translated: Yayati said:

original: yayātirasmi nahuṣasya putraḥ pūroḥ pitā sārvabhaumastvihāsam /
analyzed: yayātiḥ asmi nahuṣasya putraḥ pūroḥ pitā sārvabhaumaḥ tu iha āsam
translated: I am Yayati, the son of Nahusha, the father of Puru, the emperor here.

original: guhyaṃ mantraṃ māmakebhyo bravīmi mātāmaho bhavatāṃ suprakāśaḥ // / //
analyzed: guhyam mantram māmakebhyaḥ bravīmi mātāmahaḥ bhavatām su prakāśaḥ
translated: I am telling you my secret counsel to my own people, I am your maternal grandfather, well-known to you all.

original: sarvām imāṃ pṛthivīṃ nirjigāya ṛddhāṃ mahīmadadāṃ brāhmaṇebhyaḥ /
analyzed: sarvām imām pṛthivīm nirjigāya ṛddhām mahīm adadām brāhmaṇebhyaḥ
translated: I conquered this entire earth, and gave this prosperous land to the Brahmanas.

original: medhyānaśvānnaikaśas tānsurūpāṃs tadā devāḥ puṇyabhājo bhavanti // / //
analyzed: medhyān aśvān na ekaśas tān surūpān tadā devāḥ puṇya bhājaḥ bhavanti
translated: I gave away many well-formed sacrificial horses, then the gods become partakers of the merit.

analyzed: adām aham pṛthivīm brāhmaṇebhyaḥ pūrṇām imām akhila annaiḥ praśastām
translated: I gave away this entire earth to the Brahmanas, filled with all kinds of praiseworthy things,

original: gobhiḥ suvarṇaiśca dhanaiśca mukhyair aśvāḥ sanāgāḥ śataśastvarbudāni // / //
analyzed: gobhiḥ suvarṇaiḥ ca dhanaiḥ ca mukhyaiḥ aśvāḥ sa nāgāḥ śataśas tu arbudāni
translated: with cows, gold, and the best of wealth, with hundreds and thousands of horses and elephants.

original: satyena me dyauśca vasuṃdharā ca tathaivāgnirjvalate mānuṣeṣu /
analyzed: satyena me dyauḥ ca vasuṃdharā ca tathā eva agniḥ jvalate mānuṣeṣu
translated: By my truth, the heaven and the earth, and the fire burns among men.

original: na me vṛthā vyāhṛtameva vākyaṃ satyaṃ hi santaḥ pratipūjayanti // / //
analyzed: na me vṛthā vyāhṛtam eva vākyam satyam hi santaḥ pratipūjayanti
translated: My words are never uttered in vain. The virtuous honor truth.

original: sādhvaṣṭaka prabravīmīha satyaṃ pratardanaṃ vasumantaṃ śibiṃ ca /
analyzed: sādhu aṣṭaka prabravīmi iha satyam pratardanam vasumantam śibim ca
translated: I declare this truth, O assembly of sages, that the eight virtuous kings, Pratardana, Vasuman, and Shibi,

original: sarve devā munayaśca lokāḥ satyena pūjyā iti me manogatam // / //
analyzed: sarve devāḥ munayaḥ ca lokāḥ satyena pūjyāḥ iti me manogatam
translated: All the gods, sages, and people are to be worshipped with truth - this is my mind's conviction.

original: yo naḥ sarvajitaṃ sarvaṃ yathāvṛttaṃ nivedayet /
analyzed: yaḥ naḥ sarva jitam sarvam yathāvṛttam nivedayet
translated: He who would inform us of everything, of all our victories, as it has happened,

analyzed: anasūyuḥ sa bhajet naḥ salokatām
translated: Without malice, to the twice-born and the fire, he would enjoy the same world as us.

analyzed: śaunakaḥ uvāca
translated: Shaunaka said:

original: evaṃ rājansa mahātmā yayātiḥ svadauhitraistārito mitravaryaiḥ /
analyzed: evam rājan sa mahātmā yayātiḥ sva dauhitraiḥ tāritaḥ mitra varyaiḥ
translated: Thus, O king, the great-souled Yayati was saved by his grandsons, the best of friends.

original: tyaktvā mahīṃ paramodārakarmā svargaṃ gataḥ karmabhirvyāpya pṛthvīm // / //
analyzed: tyaktvā mahīm parama udāra karmā svargam gataḥ karmabhiḥ vyāpya pṛthvīm
translated: Having given up the earth, that one of supremely generous deeds went to heaven, having filled the earth with his deeds.

original: evaṃ sarvaṃ vistarato yathāvad ākhyātaṃ te caritaṃ nāhuṣasya /
analyzed: evam sarvam vistarataḥ yathāvat ākhyātam te caritam nāhuṣasya
translated: Thus, I have told you everything in detail, the deeds of Nahusha's son,

original: vaṃśo yasya prathitaṃ pauraveyo yasmiñjātastvaṃ manujendrakalpaḥ // / //
analyzed: vaṃśaḥ yasya prathitam pauraveyaḥ yasmin jātaḥ tvam manuja indra kalpaḥ
translated: In whose lineage you were born, O king, like a god among men.

analyzed: matsyapurāṇa
translated: Matsya Purana

analyzed: sūtaḥ uvāca
translated: Suta said:

analyzed: iti etat śaunakāt rājā śatānīkaḥ niśamya tu
translated: Having heard this from Shaunaka, King Shatanika,

analyzed: vismitaḥ parayā prītyā pūrṇa candraḥ iva ābabhau
translated: was amazed and filled with great joy, he shone like the full moon.

analyzed: pūjayāmāsa nṛpatiḥ vidhivat ca atha śaunakam
translated: And the king duly worshipped Shaunaka.

analyzed: ratnaiḥ gobhiḥ suvarṇaiḥ ca vāsobhiḥ vividhaiḥ tathā

analyzed: bṛhadrathaḥ sutaḥ tasya tasya senaḥ bhavat sutaḥ
translated: His son was Bṛhadrath, and his son was Sena.

analyzed: senasya sutapāḥ jajñe sutapaḥ tanayaḥ baliḥ
translated: Sena's son was Sutapā, and Sutapā's son was Bali.

original: jāto mānuṣayonyāṃ tu kṣīṇe vaṃśe prajecchayā // / //

analyzed: putrān utpādayāmāsa kṣetrajān pañca pārthivān

original: aṅgaṃ sa janayāmāsa vaṅgaṃ suhmaṃ tathaiva ca /
analyzed: aṅgam sa janayāmāsa vaṅgam suhmam tathā eva ca
translated: He begot Anga, Vanga, Suhma,

original: puṇḍraṃ kaliṅgaṃ ca tathā bāleyaṃ kṣetramucyate /🔽bāleyā brāhmaṇāścaiva tasya vaṃśakarāḥ prabho // / //
analyzed: puṇḍram kaliṅgam ca tathā bāleyam kṣetram ucyate  bāleyāḥ brāhmaṇāḥ ca eva tasya vaṃśa karāḥ prabho
translated: Pundra, and Kalinga. This is said to be the field of the Balhiyas.🔽The Brahmanas of the Balhiyas are the perpetuators of his race, O lord.

original: baleśca brahmaṇā datto varaḥ prītena dhīmataḥ /
analyzed: baleḥ ca brahmaṇā dattaḥ varaḥ prītena dhīmataḥ
translated: The wise and pleased Brahma granted a boon to Vali,

analyzed: mahā yogi tvam āyuḥ ca kalpasya parimāṇakam  saṃgrāme ca api ajeya tvam dharme ca eva uttamā matiḥ
translated: The state of a great Yogin, and a life of the measure of a Kalpa.🔽Invincible in battle, and the highest wisdom in religion,

analyzed: traikālya darśanam ca eva prādhānyam prasave tathā
translated: The knowledge of the past, present and future, and pre-eminence in progeny,

analyzed: jayam ca apratimam yuddhe dharme tattva artha darśanam
translated: Victory in battle, and the knowledge of the truth of religion,

original: caturo niyatānvarṇān sa vai sthāpayitā prabhuḥ // / //
analyzed: caturaḥ niyatān varṇān sa vai sthāpayitā prabhuḥ
translated: He, the lord, is the establisher of the four well-defined castes.

original: teṣāṃ ca pañca dāyādā vaṅgāṅgāḥ suhmakāstathā /
analyzed: teṣām ca pañca dāyādāḥ vaṅga aṅgāḥ suhmakāḥ tathā
translated: And their five heirs are the Vangas, Angas, Suhmas,

analyzed: puṇḍrāḥ kaliṅgāḥ ca tathā aṅgasya tu nibodhata
translated: Pundras and Kalingas. Listen to the account of Anga.

analyzed: munayaḥ ūcuḥ
translated: The sages said:

analyzed: katham baleḥ sutāḥ jātāḥ pañca tasya mahātmanaḥ
translated: How were the five sons born to the great Vali?

analyzed: katham ca utpāditāḥ tena tat naḥ prabrūhi pṛcchatām
translated: How were they begotten by him? Tell us this, we who ask.

original: māhātmyaṃ ca prabhāvaṃ ca nikhilena vadasva tat // / //
analyzed: māhātmyam ca prabhāvam ca nikhilena vadasva tat
translated: Tell me in detail about his greatness and power.

analyzed: sūtaḥ uvāca
translated: Suta said:

translated: In ancient times, there was a learned sage known as Ushija.

analyzed: patnī vai mamatā nāma babhūva asya mahātmanaḥ  uśijasya yavīyān vai bhrātṛ patnīm akāmayat
translated: The great soul had a wife named Mamata.🔽The younger brother of Ushija desired the wife of his elder brother.

analyzed: bṛhaspatiḥ mahā tejāḥ mamatām etya kāmataḥ
translated: The greatly radiant Brihaspati, out of desire, approached Mamata.

original: uvāca mamatā taṃ tu devaraṃ varavarṇinī /🔽antarvatnyasmi te bhrātur jyeṣṭhasya tu viramyatām // / //
analyzed: uvāca mamatā tam tu devaram varavarṇinī  antarvatnī asmi te bhrātuḥ jyeṣṭhasya tu viramyatām
translated: The beautiful Mamata told her brother-in-law:🔽I am pregnant with my brother's child, so desist.

analyzed: ayam tu me mahābhāga garbhaḥ kupyet bṛhaspate
translated: O greatly fortunate one, O Brihaspati, this embryo of mine may become angry.

analyzed: auśijaḥ bhrātṛ janyaḥ te sa upāṅgam vedam udgiran
translated: It is the son of Ushija, born from your sister, and will vomit forth the Vedas with their auxiliaries.

analyzed: amogha retāḥ tvam ca api na mām bhajitum arhasi
translated: You should not have intercourse with me, as your seed is infallible.

original: asminn evaṃ gate kāle yathā vā manyase prabho // / //
analyzed: asmin evam gate kāle yathā vā manyase prabho
translated: In this situation, do as you think fit, O Lord.

analyzed: evam uktaḥ tathā samyak bṛhat tejāḥ bṛhaspatiḥ
translated: Thus addressed, the greatly radiant Brihaspati,

original: kāmātmā sa mahātmāpi na manaḥ so 'bhyavārayat // / //
analyzed: kāma ātmā sa mahātmā api na manaḥ saḥ bhyavārayat
translated: though having a lustful mind, did not restrain his mind.

analyzed: saṃbabhūva eva dharma ātmā tayā sārdham akāmayā
translated: The righteous one had intercourse with her, though unwilling.

analyzed: utsṛjantam tu tat retaḥ vācam garbhaḥ bhyabhāṣata
translated: As he was about to cast it off, the embryo spoke to him.

analyzed: bho tāta vācām adhipa dvayoḥ nā asti iha saṃsthitiḥ
translated: O father, lord of speech, there is no place here for two of us.

original: amogharetāstvaṃ cāpi pūrvaṃ cāhamihāgataḥ // / //🔽so 'śapattaṃ tataḥ kruddha evamukto bṛhaspatiḥ /
analyzed: amogha retāḥ tvam ca api pūrvam ca aham iha āgataḥ  saḥ śapat tam tatas kruddhaḥ evam uktaḥ bṛhaspatiḥ
translated: You are one whose seed is never fruitless, and I have come here first.🔽Then, thus addressed, Brihaspati, the illustrious Rishi, became angry and cursed him.

original: putraṃ jyeṣṭhasya vai bhrātur garbhasthaṃ bhagavānṛṣiḥ // / //
analyzed: putram jyeṣṭhasya vai bhrātuḥ garbha stham bhagavān ṛṣiḥ
translated: The eldest brother's son, who was in the womb, he cursed.

analyzed: yasmāt tvam īdṛśe kāle niṣedhasi
translated: Since you, even while in the womb, are forbidding me at such a time,

analyzed: mām evam uktavān tasmāt tamaḥ dīrgham pravekṣyasi
translated: having spoken to me thus, therefore you will enter long darkness.

original: tato dīrghatamā nāma śāpādṛṣirajāyata /🔽ato 'ṃśajo bṛhatkīrtir bṛhaspatirivaujasā // / //
analyzed: tatas dīrghatamāḥ nāma śāpāt ṛṣiḥ ajāyata  atas ṃśa jaḥ bṛhat kīrtiḥ bṛhaspatiḥ iva ojasā
translated: Then, by the curse, the Rishi named Dirgha-tamas was born.🔽From a part of him, the greatly famous one, like Brihaspati in splendor, was born.

analyzed: ūrdhvaretāḥ tatas sau vai vasate bhrātuḥ āśrame
translated: Then he, with his seed drawn up, lived in his brother's hermitage.

analyzed: sa dharmān saurabheyān tu vṛṣabhāt śrutavān tatas
translated: He then heard from Vrisha the duties of a Surabhi cow.

original: tasya bhrātā pitṛvyo yaś cakāra bharaṇaṃ tadā /
analyzed: tasya bhrātā pitṛvyaḥ yaḥ cakāra bharaṇam tadā
translated: His brother, who was his paternal uncle, then provided for him.

analyzed: tasmin nivasataḥ tasya yadṛcchātaḥ tu vai vṛṣaḥ
translated: While he was living there, by chance, the bull

analyzed: yajña artham āhṛtān darbhān cacāra surabhīsutaḥ
translated: of Surabhi's son wandered into the sacrificial enclosure where sacrificial animals were kept.🔽The son of Surabhi wandered into the sacrificial enclosure where sacrificial animals were kept, for the sake of the sacrifice.

analyzed: jagrāha tam dīrghatamāḥ śṛṅgayoḥ tu catuṣpadam
translated: Dīrghatamas seized him by the horns with his two feet.

analyzed: tena asau nigṛhītaḥ ca na cacāla padāt padam
translated: He was thus restrained by him, but did not move a step.

original: tato 'bravīdvṛṣastaṃ vai muñca māṃ balināṃ vara // / //🔽na mayāsāditastāta balavāṃstvatsamaḥ kvacit /
analyzed: tatas bravīt vṛṣaḥ tam vai muñca mām balinām vara  na mayā āsāditaḥ tāta balavān tvad samaḥ kvacid
translated: Then the bull said to him: Release me, O best of the strong.🔽O father, I have never met anywhere a stronger one like you.

original: mama cānyaḥ samo vāpi na hi me balasaṃkhyayā /
analyzed: mama ca anyaḥ samaḥ vā api na hi me bala saṃkhyayā
translated: And none is equal to me in strength, for I have no count of my strength.

original: muñca tāteti ca punaḥ prītaste 'haṃ varaṃ vṛṇu // / //
analyzed: muñca tāta iti ca punar prītaḥ te ham varam vṛṇu
translated: Release me, O father, and I am pleased with you, choose a boon.

analyzed: evam uktaḥ bravīt enam jīvan me tvam kva yāsyasi
translated: Thus addressed, he said to him: Where will you go, alive, from me?

original: eṣa tvāṃ na vimokṣyāmi parasvādaṃ catuṣpadam // / //
analyzed: eṣa tvām na vimokṣyāmi para svādam catuṣpadam
translated: I will not release you, the four-footed eater of others' property.

original: vṛṣabha uvāca🔽nāsmākaṃ vidyate tāta pātakaṃ steyameva ca /
analyzed: vṛṣabhaḥ uvāca  na asmākam vidyate tāta pātakam steyam eva ca
translated: The bull said:🔽O father, we have no sin or theft.

original: bhakṣyābhakṣyaṃ tathā caiva peyāpeyaṃ tathaiva ca // / //
analyzed: bhakṣya abhakṣyam tathā ca eva peya apeyam tathā eva ca
translated: Nor what is to be eaten and what is not to be eaten, nor what is to be drunk and what is not to be drunk.

original: dvipadāṃ bahavo hy ete dharma eṣa gavāṃ smṛtaḥ /
analyzed: dvipadām bahavaḥ hi ete dharmaḥ eṣa gavām smṛtaḥ
translated: For these many bipeds, this is the dharma of cows, remembered.

original: kāryākārye na vāgamyāgamanaṃ ca tathaiva ca // / //
analyzed: kārya akārye na vā agamyā gamanam ca tathā eva ca
translated: What is to be done and what is not to be done, and likewise approaching and not approaching.

analyzed: sūtaḥ uvāca
translated: Sūta said:

analyzed: gavām dharmam tu vai śrutvā saṃbhrāntaḥ tu visṛjya tam
translated: Having heard the dharma of cows, he was confused and released him.

analyzed: śaktyā anna pāna dānāt tu gopatim saṃprasādayat
translated: By the gift of food and drink, he pleased the Lord of cows.

original: prasādite gate tasmin godharmaṃ bhaktitastu saḥ /
analyzed: prasādite gate tasmin go dharmam bhaktitaḥ tu saḥ
translated: When that one, having been propitiated, had departed, he, devoted to the cow-vow,

analyzed: manasā eva samādadhyau tad niṣṭhaḥ tatparaḥ hi saḥ
translated: meditated on the cow-vow with his mind alone, being intent on that, devoted to that.

analyzed: tatas yavīyasaḥ patnīm gautamasya abhyapadyata
translated: Then he approached the wife of Gautama, who was younger than him.

original: kṛtāvalepāṃ tāṃ matvā so 'naḍvāniva na kṣamaḥ // / //
analyzed: kṛta avalepām tām matvā saḥ naḍvān iva na kṣamaḥ
translated: Considering her to be one who had made an agreement, he was not able like an ox.

analyzed: go dharmam tu param matvā snuṣām tām abhyapadyata
translated: But considering the cow-vow to be supreme, he approached his daughter-in-law.

original: nirbhartsya cainaṃ ruddhvā ca bāhubhyāṃ sampragṛhya ca // / //
analyzed: nirbhartsya ca enam ruddhvā ca bāhubhyām sampragṛhya ca
translated: And having rebuked him, and having bound him with his arms,

analyzed: bhāvyam artham tu tam jñātvā māhātmyāt tam uvāca sā
translated: knowing that he was destined to be her husband, she spoke to him out of greatness,

analyzed: viparyayam tu tvam labdhvā anaḍvān iva vartase
translated: You have obtained a reversal, and you behave like an ox.

analyzed: gamya agamyam na jānīṣe go dharmāt prārthayan sutām
translated: Not knowing what is to be approached and what is not to be approached, you seek the daughter through the cow-vow.

original: durvṛttaṃ tvāṃ tyajāmyadya gaccha tvaṃ svena karmaṇā // / //
analyzed: durvṛttam tvām tyajāmi adya gaccha tvam svena karmaṇā
translated: I abandon you today, you of bad conduct, go by your own action.

analyzed: kāṣṭhe samudge prakṣipya gaṅgā ambhasi samutsṛjat
translated: Having thrown him into a wooden box, she cast him into the waters of the Ganges.🔽Since you are blind, old, and difficult to support,

analyzed: yasmāt tvam andhaḥ vṛddhaḥ ca bhartavyaḥ duradhiṣṭhitaḥ
translated: you are to be maintained.

analyzed: tam uhyamānam vegena srotasaḥ bhyāśam āgataḥ
translated: As he was being carried away by the current, he came near the bank.

original: jagrāha taṃ sa dharmātmā balir vairocanistadā // / //
analyzed: jagrāha tam sa dharma ātmā baliḥ vairocaniḥ tadā
translated: The righteous Bali, the son of Virochana, then seized him.

original: antaḥpure jugopainaṃ bhakṣyabhojyaiśca tarpayan /🔽prītaścaiva vareṇaiva cchandayāmāsa vai balim // / //
analyzed: antaḥpure jugopa enam bhakṣya bhojyaiḥ ca tarpayan  prītaḥ ca eva vareṇa eva chandayāmāsa vai balim
translated: He kept him in the inner quarters and satisfied him with food and drink.🔽And being pleased, he offered Bali a boon.

original: tasmācca sa varaṃ vavre putrārthe dānavarṣabhaḥ /🔽saṃtānārthaṃ mahābhāgabhāryāyāṃ mama mānada /
analyzed: tasmāt ca sa varam vavre putra arthe dānava ṛṣabhaḥ  saṃtāna artham mahābhāga bhāryāyām mama mānada
translated: And for the sake of a son, that bull among the demons asked for a boon from him.

analyzed: putrān dharma artha tattva jñān utpādayitum arhasi
translated: O illustrious one, O giver of honor, it is proper for you to beget sons who know the truth of dharma and artha in my wife for the sake of progeny.

analyzed: evam uktaḥ tha devarṣiḥ tathā astu iti uktavān prabhuḥ
translated: Thus addressed, the divine sage, the lord, said, Let it be so.

original: sa tasya rājā svāṃ bhāryāṃ sudeṣṇāṃ nāma prāhiṇot /
analyzed: sa tasya rājā svām bhāryām sudeṣṇām nāma prāhiṇot
translated: And the king sent his own wife named Sudeṣṇā to him.

original: andhaṃ vṛddhaṃ ca taṃ jñātvā na sā devī jagāma ha // / //🔽śūdrāṃ dhātreyikāṃ tasmāv andhāya prāhiṇottadā /
analyzed: andham vṛddham ca tam jñātvā na sā devī jagāma ha  śūdrām dhātreyikām andhāya prāhiṇot tadā
translated: Knowing him to be blind and old, that queen did not go.🔽Then he sent a Shudra nursemaid to that blind man.

analyzed: tasyām kakṣīvat ādīn ca śūdra yonau ṛṣiḥ vaśī
translated: And in her, the self-controlled sage begot Kakshīvān and others, in the Shudra caste.

analyzed: janayāmāsa dharma ātmā śūdrān iti evam ādikam
translated: The righteous one begot sons like Kakshīvān and others in the Shudra caste.

original: uvāca taṃ balī rājā dṛṣṭvā kakṣīvadādikān // / //
analyzed: uvāca tam baliḥ rājā dṛṣṭvā kakṣīvat ādikān
translated: Thus spoke the king Bali, seeing Kakshīvān and others.

analyzed: rājā uvāca
translated: The king said:

analyzed: pravīṇān ṛṣi dharmasya ca īśvarān brahma vādinaḥ
translated: Skilled in the duties of sages, lords, expounders of the Vedas,

original: vidvān pratyakṣadharmāṇāṃ buddhimān vṛttimāñchucīn // / //🔽mamaiva ceti hovāca taṃ dīrghatamasaṃ baliḥ /
analyzed: vidvān pratyakṣa dharmāṇām buddhimān vṛttimān śucīn  mama eva ca iti ha uvāca tam dīrghatamasam baliḥ
translated: Learned, with direct knowledge of dharma, intelligent, well-behaved, pure,🔽And said to him, They are mine alone.

analyzed: muniḥ tam vai mama evam iti ca abravīt
translated: The sage replied to him, They are mine alone.

analyzed: utpannāḥ tu bhavat chande sura uttama
translated: O best of gods, born from the womb of a Shudra, out of your desire,

original: andhaṃ vṛddhaṃ ca māṃ jñātvā sudeṣṇā mahiṣī tava /
analyzed: andham vṛddham ca mām jñātvā sudeṣṇā mahiṣī tava
translated: Knowing me to be blind and old, your queen Sudeṣṇā,

analyzed: prāhiṇot avamānāt me śūdrām dhātreyikām nṛpa
translated: Sent me a Shudra nursemaid out of contempt, O king.

analyzed: tatas prasādayāmāsa baliḥ tam ṛṣi sattamam
translated: Then Bali propitiated that best of sages,

original: baliḥ sudeṣṇāṃ tāṃ bhāryāṃ bhartsayāmāsa dānavaḥ // / //
analyzed: baliḥ sudeṣṇām tām bhāryām bhartsayāmāsa dānavaḥ
translated: And the demon Bali rebuked that wife of his, Sudeṣṇā,

analyzed: punar ca enām alaṃkṛtya ṛṣaye pratyapādayat
translated: And again adorned her and presented her to the sage.

original: tāṃ sa dīrghatamā devīṃ tathā kṛtavatīṃ tadā // / //🔽dadhnā lavaṇamiśreṇa tv abhyaktaṃ madhukena tu /
analyzed: tām sa dīrghatamāḥ devīm tathā kṛtavatīm tadā  dadhnā lavaṇa miśreṇa tu abhyaktam madhukena tu
translated: Then that goddess, who had been treated thus by him,🔽Anointed with ghee mixed with salt and licorice,

analyzed: liha mām a jugupsantī āpādatalamastakam
translated: Lick me from the soles of the feet to the top of the head without disgust.

analyzed: tatas tvam prāpsyase devi putrān vai manasā īpsitān
translated: Then, O goddess, you will obtain sons as desired by the mind.

original: tasya sā tadvaco devī sarvaṃ kṛtavatī tadā /
analyzed: tasya sā tat vacaḥ devī sarvam kṛtavatī tadā
translated: The goddess did everything as he said.

analyzed: tasya sā apānam āsādya devī pariharat tadā
translated: Having obtained that drink, the goddess then avoided it.

original: tāmuvāca tataḥ so 'tha yatte parihṛtaṃ śubhe /
analyzed: tām uvāca tatas saḥ yat te parihṛtam śubhe
translated: Then he said to her, O auspicious one, what you have avoided,

analyzed: vinā apānam kumāram tu janayiṣyasi pūrvajam
translated: you will give birth to an elder son without that drink.

analyzed: sudeṣṇā uvāca
translated: Sudeṣṇā said:

original: nārhasi tvaṃ mahābhāga putraṃ me dātumīdṛśam /
analyzed: na arhasi tvam mahābhāga putram me dātum īdṛśam
translated: O illustrious one, you should not give me such a son.

original: toṣitaśca yathāśakti prasādaṃ kuru me prabho // / //
analyzed: toṣitaḥ ca yathāśakti prasādam kuru me prabho
translated: And I have satisfied you to the best of my ability, O lord, be gracious to me.

analyzed: dīrghatamāḥ uvāca
translated: Dīrghatamas said:

analyzed: tava apacārāt devi eṣa na anyathā bhavitā śubhe
translated: O goddess, this will not be otherwise due to your misconduct, O auspicious one.

original: naiva dāsyati putraste pautrau vai dāsyate phalam // / //
analyzed: na eva dāsyati putraḥ te pautrau vai dāsyate phalam
translated: Your son will not give, but the grandsons will give the fruit.

analyzed: tasya apānam vinā ca eva yogya bhāvaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: And he will be fit without that drink of yours.

analyzed: tasmāt dīrghatamāḥ aṅgeṣu kukṣau spṛṣṭvā idam abravīt
translated: Therefore, touching the limbs of Dīrghatamas, he said this in his womb.

analyzed: prāśitam yat yat aṅgeṣu na sopastham śuci smite
translated: Whatever is eaten in the limbs, not the private parts, O you of a beautiful smile,

analyzed: skannam retaḥ satyadhṛteḥ dṛṣṭvā ca apsarasam jale

analyzed: mithunam tatra saṃbhṛtam tasmin sarasi saṃbhṛtam

analyzed: tatas sarasi tasmin tu kramamāṇam mahīpatiḥ
translated: Then, in that lake, the king saw the one walking.

analyzed: dṛṣṭvā jagrāha kṛpayā śaṃtanuḥ mṛgayām gataḥ
translated: Seeing him, King Shantanu, who had gone hunting, compassionately took him.

original: ete śaradvataḥ putrā ākhyātā gautamā varāḥ /
analyzed: ete śaradvataḥ putrāḥ ākhyātāḥ gautamāḥ varāḥ
translated: These sons of Sharadvata have been mentioned, the excellent ones of the Gautama lineage.

analyzed: atas ūrdhvam pravakṣyāmi divodāsasya vai prajāḥ

analyzed: divodāsasya dāyādaḥ dharmiṣṭhaḥ mitrayuḥ nṛpaḥ

analyzed: maitrāyaṇa avaraḥ saḥ tha maitreyaḥ tu tatas smṛtaḥ
translated: He was the last of the Maitrayas, and then Maitreya is remembered.

original: ete vaṃśyā yateḥ pakṣāḥ kṣatropetāstu bhārgavāḥ /
analyzed: ete vaṃśyāḥ yateḥ pakṣāḥ kṣatra upetāḥ tu bhārgavāḥ

original: rājā caidyavaro nāma maitreyasya sutaḥ smṛtaḥ // / //
analyzed: rājā caidyavaraḥ nāma maitreyasya sutaḥ smṛtaḥ
translated: And the son of Maitreya is known as King Chaidyarava.

analyzed: atha caidyavarāt vidvān sudāsaḥ tasya ca ātmajaḥ
translated: Then, from Chaidyarava, the learned Sudasa was his son.

original: ajamīḍhaḥ punarjātaḥ kṣīṇe vaṃśe tu somakaḥ // / //🔽somakasya suto jantur hate tasmiñchataṃ babhau /
analyzed: ajamīḍhaḥ punar jātaḥ kṣīṇe vaṃśe tu somakaḥ  somakasya sutaḥ jantuḥ hate tasmin śatam babhau

analyzed: putrāṇām ajamīḍhasya somakasya mahātmanaḥ

analyzed: mahiṣī tu ajamīḍhasya dhūminī putra vardhinī
translated: The queen of Ajamiḍha, Dhūminī, was the enhancer of sons.

translated: In the absence of a son, she performed austerities for a hundred years, which were difficult to perform.🔽Having offered oblations into the fire in the prescribed manner, she purified her food.

analyzed: agnihotra krameṇa eva sā suṣvāpa mahā vratā
translated: In the same sequence as the Agnihotra, that one of great vows slept.

analyzed: tasyām vai dhūma varṇāyām ajamīḍhaḥ samīyivān
